alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 11 at 7:03PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until noon EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 659 PM EDT, Emergency management reported that the Russell Road is closed from the cemetery to the McNamee Road due to flooding. Please avoid this area and do not remove any barricades. If water is running across a road it is possible that the road could be washed-out. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Fairfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
